Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: unckyherb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Brando & Gio for the last three nights of our 50 day trip. We stayed in lots of hotels, most were better than this one. The staff was indifferent, I don't know if it was because they were rude, or just didn't understand English. Answers to our questions were short and curt. We had contact with them only during check in and check out. The room was small, but clean. The bathroom was adequate. We were in a non-smoking room, but the adjoining room apparently was smoking. The beds were small and very uncomfortable. Free internet. Positives: Ten minute walk to the main train terminal Very low price Elevator Free Internet Very Clean Good neighborhood - lots of restaurants nearby Negatives: Small room Small uncomfortable beds We decided that we would be out of the room most of the time, so we would sacrifice comfort for location and price. Luckily the weather was good, if it was raining, it would be tough to spend a lot of time in the room. If you are looking just for a place to sleep, this will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ivelina V
Reviews.Content: The room wasnt the same that we booked so we had to pay 50euro to get our room,whatever we stayed 5 nights.No breakfast,the staff was not friendly AT ALL,i do not recomended

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Young C
Reviews.Content: My partner I I booked this hotel 9 months in advance for our stay of 1 night. Three months after the booking was made, we received an email advising our booking was cancelled and no explanation provided. We immediately sent an email asking why, and a response was received some days later advising a mistake was made with our name and the booking was cancelled by accident. We were then advised if we wished to rebook, the room would now be double the cost, after the hotel made the mistake and cancelled our booking! Needless to say, we did not re-book the room.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anthony H
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and tidy with the added bonus of an in room safe. Bathroom was tiny, but clean and sufficient. I would definitely recommend this for the budget conscious traveller. Good location close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Castelfidardo, Rome”
Reviews.Author: rosemariemccaskie
Reviews.Content: Plenty of space with a comfy queen bed for me and a single for my travelling partner. Clean and air conditioned room, which was great as it was VERY hot! It looked like our room may have been recently refurbished. A tiny lift (that worked well). Ideally situated near Termini and walkable to some tourist spots. Good restaurants and bars nearby. Street not so noisy as others.

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff somewhat disorganised”
Reviews.Author: KazzarM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of my time in Italy. It is located close to Roma Termini station which is great for travelling beyond Rome but it is a fair walking distance to all the other tourist sights. When I arrived the first time I was lead to a room which already had someone elses bag in it. It seemed they weren't sure where I should be. I ended up in a double room, near reception which was quite ok if not a little noisy at times. The beds were very hard but I found this to be common throughout Italy. The second visit I was in a single room which was very small but was quiet with a bathroom adequate for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location (in relation to Termini)”
Reviews.Author: Robbo_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, very friendly staff and generally very clean. Didn't change the towels during our whole stay, but otherwise the room was cleaned reasonably well and bed made. Had air con in the room but the bathroom was rather small. Shower was a a bit weak. Breakfast was included and taken at a cafe further down the block, but was nothing to write home about and was just a coffee each and croissant. Price may not have been best value for money but it was overall and fine experience here.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but not more”
Reviews.Author: Luleaiscold
Reviews.Content: Very much a "budget-hotel" in a backstreet, so it wasn´t so nice to be heading home much to late, but besides that very close by to the central station and good restaurant and a good supermarket (condeti). The room was ok, but in the bathroom we found some muld :-( and the staff wasn´t so good at english, but they tryed to help us with directions when we asked on the map. The hotel was ok, but that´s it. The room was kind of small.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water.”
Reviews.Author: JudithS154
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, prior to starting an Intrepid Trip. We joined the Intrepid group at this Hotel. It is within walking distance of Termini. Te room size was adequate and it was clean. However the shower did not have hot water - the only way we could have a shower was freezing cold. It was not fixed in the time we were there. Others in the tour group had same problem in their rooms. After 3 days we had to ask for our towels to be changed and bathroom to be cleaned, otherwise we would not have had clean towels offered in 4 days. The gentleman at Reception was rude and barely acknowledged us on arrival, and checkin. His manner did not change the whole time we were there. There was another man on reception at times who was much more pleasant. No Wifi or internet. Lift access to the hotel on 3rd floor. If you don't mind being in Rome in 40degree heat and not being able to have a shower - this may be the hotel for you, otherwise go else where.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not clean enough”
Reviews.Author: gw9y2k
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 night at the hotel. The location is perfect, just some minutes from Termini station (I came from the airport). The room was really comfortable and very good furnished, with WORKING air-conditioning. The room was very loud because of the street but if you close the windows you can't hear anything from outside. Staff is helpful and they are nice people. If you smile on them, they smile back. I had problems with the plug (in my country the electricity system is other), but the girl at the reception gave me an adapter. The only negative: my room was not clean enough. I mean on the mirror were dirty spots and I also found some long hair. All in all, the hotel is worth for another stay at Rome. L.V. Hungary

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to kick off our holiday in europe”
Reviews.Author: buck8444
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome after a hell 24 flight. So wasn't in the right frame of mind when we walked into the hotel. The antiquated lift at first scared me but became my best friend! The hotel staff were a family it seemed and seemed a bit bemused by two tired kiwis wanting a room. We were a bit early so had a coffee and came back. I was pleasantly surprised. Wooden shutter windows looking into a italian courtyard, nice clean rooms. Stayed there for 4 nights so got the hang of the metro. I would recommed this Hotel. Its not 5 star,but it fitted well with us. During our stay in europe we stayed in over a dozen hotels and this one was fine compared to some!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: bryon_10
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is very much aimed at the budget market.I went basic without breakfast.It was a five minuet walk from the rail station,and was located on the third floor of a large building.There is a lift so no problem.The staff speak English,and were friendly enough.There was one shower,but for some reason nobody seemed to use it.Maybe some rooms have their own?t they have free wi fi, but they were having problems with it while I was there.,..The room was clean,and I was surprised to find a safe in the room.There is also A TV.The location is great.In fact I walked everywhere without needing public transport,even to the Vatican.But I know not everyone wants to walk a lot,but there are plenty of buses running from the rail station Plenty of places to eat nearby,and a small supermarket at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Greekkola
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on my own and couldn't have been happier with my stay. The rooms were exactly what I expected for the price I was paying, comparable to other hotels I've stayed at in Europe. My dealings with the desk staff, both day and night was very pleasant and courteous. They both spoke English and were encouraging when I attempted bits of Italian. The hotel was convenient for walking or transit to most sites in Rome. I could find no fault with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: JulesSunderland
Reviews.Content: Would like to say we were very pleased with this hotel.....we arrived and were given keys for 2 rooms across the road in DiscoverRoma (a 5 room part of the Hotel chain).....We were worried as i'd read on here bad things about rooms over the road....but to our delight we were pleasantly surprised as the rooms were very nice, son had room at back of block with balcony and we were at front facing street (only bad thing was that workman were working on front of building, so scaffolding was there and bit noisy in the morning) but didn't bother us much as we're early rises. Room was cleaned everyday to high standard. It's an ideal base for seeing all the sights, very close to Termini station. On last day we could leave our bags there all day until our flight too. Couldn't fault this hotel and would go back no problem.

Reviews.Title: “value for money in italian capital”
Reviews.Author: rkpathk
Reviews.Content: HOTEL CASTELFIDARDO Via castelfidardo 31 00185 Rome We stayed there for three days and two nights. The place is very conveniently located near roma termini (main railway station) and we could walk down up to the hotel. The famous street via xxth century and beautiful Republica squire is very nearby. You can walk from the hotel to metro station, to get buses for any destination in and around Rome, and also to avail tram services. The hotel is on both sides of the road and some one should be there to guide you to the reception desk on one side, and rooms on the other side of the road. It has a very old and small lift enough to accommodate a couple with their luggage. The room was quite, airy, clean and specious, with tv, small fridge, and modern bath room. Towels were changed every day. it was value for money in Rome where the rate was only 85 euro per night on which were given 10% discount for cash payment. Morning breakfast (coffee and a bun) is included which is to be taken across the street in a café. . We are thankful to our son and daughter in law in Milan who chose this hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Chikira
Reviews.Content: We have booked a double standard room for three days in Rome. When we arrived we found out that the owner has two other hotels.Hotel lazzari and B&B Andu and Lu. He took us to Andy and Lu. The room was too small so it was the bathroom. The cover of the bed was dirty and so it was the quilt so we took the only blanket that it was kind of clean!! Walls were also dirty. The staff wasn't helpful at all. They manage to make our journey to Rome a disaster!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “our stay at castelfidardo”
Reviews.Author: walton21
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel recently and found it very nice.rooms were very clean and basic.did the job as we didnt spend much time in the room.beds were made everyday and new towels too but there was no tv in our room. it can be noisy if u have people shouting in the hall way. the hotel is on the 3rd floor of a building but has a lift(very old lift but it does d job).i would stay here again as it was cheap and clean and also in a good area for transport and safety. we went in feb aand the weather was great also it was quiter for tourist to get around.markets daily near dis hotel.easy to get to from the termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great price”
Reviews.Author: NanaGCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after we found the name in a popular travel guide. It is very close to the train station and VERY affordable! The rooms were clean and perfect for a budget holiday. The staff was nice, but we did not expect 5* service for that price. There was even an in room safe, which was very convenient. Just before we had to leave Rome I fell down stairs and twisted my ankle. The staff was very helpful and helped us to a hospital. This is the perfect base for a holiday in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, typical for this price range in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pennae
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, tiny bathrooms, but not at all unexpected for Rome in this price range. We stayed here at the beginning of an Intrepid tour and found it quite a hike from the train station with luggage, but not a bad walk without luggage. Breakfast is sometimes included - you get a voucher to take next door for a coffee and pastry (note: Italians don't "do" breakfast, get used to espresso and a pastry!). Staff were friendly, one in particular a little *too* friendly, propositioning myself and a couple of others. An OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near to centre”
Reviews.Author: katka7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent, but before we checked it on internet. It seemed to by good hotel near to centre so we´ve decided to stay there. When we came there the hotel was as we expected. It was good, clean, man at the desk was kind and helpful. Room was small but clean, with TV, good beds and at night was silent. The bathroom was very small but also clean, with towels and hot water which was important for us as we were there in february and weather was quite cold. Breakfast were really very tiny, only one croissant or cake with coffee or cappuccino or tea. But we woke up early at morning so it was good start of a day. The hotel is max 10 minutes of walk from TERMINI station (metro or bus). About Two minutes from hotel is supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “good location, otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: parityerror
Reviews.Content: Location: Right near Rome Central Station, about 4 blocks or 5 minutes brisk walk. Nearby to good food, able to join bus tours, etc. The people around the neighborhood were not too bad, a few gypsies but otherwise I generally felt safe. A supermarket located very close by, I saved many $$ by shopping there. Hotel generally: The hotel is old and has character. The elevator is manually operated, you must open and close the doors by hand, then only press the button once everything is ready. It was sometimes quicker to walk up 4 flights of stairs, but I enjoyed the novelty. The hotel can be hard to locate for the first time, you need to press the doorbell to get inside (extra security is OK with me) Check-in: The staff were a bit rough, but still helpful. Quick check-in Room: Small room. Air conditioned, but difficult to use. There are no blinds on the window, only a big solid shutter (ie either completely open or completely shut). This is probably just a "Europe" thing, I hadn't been to Italy before. The room smelt of cigarettes when I first arrived, so I left the windows open for a while which cleared the smell quite quickly. There was ample space around the bed for luggage. Not a huge room, but big enough for me. The bed wasn't too comfy, you get what you pay for... No noise from outside, very quiet. Facilities: None Breakfast: None included. There was food nearby, so this wasn't a problem. Tours: The tours offered through the hotel (brochures in the room) were very expensive, but on par with other tour companies. I'd suggest shopping around before you spend the money. Overall: The hotel was good value. Next time I think I will stay in a hostel though, save my money.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: UlverstonJanet
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this hotel for four days. It was basic but perfectly adequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. Breakfast at the cafe on the corner was coffee and a criossant, not a lot but typical of hotel breakfasts in this area. The area felt safe for three middle aged women walking around at night. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_guest
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the nice reviews I found here and the excellent price, but to be honest it turned out to be really below my expectations. I am not very demanding with hotels when I travel for tourism cause I don't spend a lot of time in the rooms, but there were a series of disappointments with this one that forced me to write this negative review. I hope I am being fair, it's nothing too bad, but I think travellers need to have a real expectation so as not to be disappointed as I was. - First problem is that I called them before travelling and asked the receptionist if they had wireless internet available, he said they didn't have it in the rooms, but that I could bring my laptop to the reception area and there I would be able to connect to a wireless network. That led me to bring my laptop in the trip which is always a hassle cause it's quite heavy. When I went to the reception with it in the first night, I saw two secured networks, asked the receptionist which was the hotel one (X or Y) and the guy promptly said 'it's X'. Then I asked him what the password was and to my surprise he said 'I thought it didn't require any password'; I asked him to check that information with some colleague or support, and he crankily replied: 'no, no, i have no idea what the password is and there is no one I can ask about it too, no one knows. I'm sorry I can't help you'. I found it funny and asked about the network and password to another guy, who was there the day after. Then he was clear from the beggining, that the hotel didn't supply any network, but that some people have already occasionally managed to connect to some unsecured network that was available by chance in the hotel area. Well, I found it all funny but if you think about it, it is extremely unprofessional of them to tell the costumer that they did have a network in the reception area. - The rooms: we had the bad luck of getting a smoking room which had a very strong and unpleasant stale cigarrete smell. The furniture was not new, as I read in another review. The room was small, with a tiny wardrobe, some yellow stains in the walls and even a small brown stain in the bedlinen. The floor is tiled, which makes it cold and there were no mats. - The bathroom: the shower had a drainage problem forming an unpleasant pool with water coming back from the drain, and the toilet seat was loose, detaching from the wall - everytime I sat on it, it creaked and I was afraid it would fall off the wall - and I am not a big person! - Internal noise: despite being turned to the back of the building and not on the main street, our room was extremely noisy, because there is no acoustic isolation between the room door and the hotel public area. The result is that although we were not next to reception, we could hear interphone and phone ringing, people talking, people walking on the tiled corridor, and even the cleaners would start their work early in the morning (8) and wouldn't spare guests from all sorts of noises like plastic, buckets, brooms, hoover, etc. - I didn't have the guts to get into the tiny and ancient elevator of the building, so if you don't fancy that as well prepare to climb three floors of stairs. - Finally, the breakfast: it is literally one cup of coffee and one tiny slice of sponge cake (I've attached a picture). If you want anything more in the bar, which is next door, you have to pay for it, at reasonable prices. I find it misleading to say they serve any kind of breakfast. It would be better for the hotel not to create any expectations regarding this because it is a bit shocking (you could see the look in everyone's face - 'but this is all'?!). Maybe the only thing I liked there was the location, because it's kind of close to termini station and has nice family restaurants in the area (there is one called 'Trattoria La Famiglia', which I highly reccomend). But the hotel has no signs outside and it took me about 15 minutes circulating the area trying to find it! All in all, as I said I don't give much importance to hotel rooms especially cause I usually travel for tourism and on a budget, but I think it is good to have the right expectations. Unfortunately based on the experience I had I wouldn't reccommend this hotel... I think it is worth it to pay some extra 20 euros and find a better place. Rome is the most beautiful city I've ver been to and I will definitely come back, but I will look for some other place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Booked on short notice, happily surprised”
Reviews.Author: thorpite
Reviews.Content: Our plans to stay with family in Rome fell through at the last minute. The kind owners of the B&B we stayed at in Florence called ahead and booked our stay only a few days before we arrived in Rome. Booking on such short notice, I was worried about what we would get, but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, we had a/c, our own bathroom and the room had private access to a rooftop patio with table and chairs! Not bad for 48 hours notice! The walk to the Termini was not bad at all, it was easy to get back and forth with some places to stop for breakfast in the morning or for a snack in the afternoon when we got back from sight-seeing. For dinner, we ate once at the place directly next door. I'm not sure if it was because they could tell we were tourists, but they added all kinds of items to our bill that we had not ordered. I pointed it out (in Italian) and our waiter said he would take those items off the bill, but he never did. We just refused to pay for those items, paid the rest of the bill and left. There were some good places in the area, so try as many out as possible. The staff at the hotel were great. There was one man in particular who seemed to be at the front desk for the duration of our stay. He was very nice and was able to suggest places to eat, things to see. And he went out of his way making sure I had a cab to take me to the airport when I left. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it. It's in a charming building and I loved the old fashioned lift.

Reviews.Title: “Have never stayed here and never will”
Reviews.Author: Elpheba
Reviews.Content: Ok, in the interest of full disclosure, I didn't actually stay here. And it may be a perfectly nice hotel, but I just had such a bad experience with them over the phone that I know I will never grace them with my presence. Long story short: I needed some information from the front desk, the "gentleman" on the front desk informed me that he was too busy with a group at the desk and then ... he... hung up. In a word, it was rude. And I have a high tolerance for rudeness. But this was truly rude. And so here's my thought process: if you employ someone at your hotel who thinks this is an appropriate manner in which to address a person, I can't imagine I would enjoy myself staying at your hotel, and I don't want to give my custom. Simple as that. Nice = make money. Not nice = lose money. I don't think asking for a little civility is too much. Especially in the *hospitality* industry. But maybe that's just me.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: JulieRomania
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for three nights at this hotel. In the building, the Castefidardo hotel owns the third floor and another hotel, Lazzari, the second. The hotel is renovated, new furniture, clean bathroom, all that on 1 star hotel. The room was great, right across the front desk. Not very big, but ok, windows above the main street which was noisy but the windows were soundproofing. The TV was small and had just Italian channels. The bathroom was very clean, so was the room. Everything is new. The man at the front desk was an old funny man, he was helpful. The hotel has no internet, but there are some cheap internet points nearby. A quite big supermarket at 1 minute walking distance. Many restaurants around, but not all of them so good. watch out in Italy for coperto&services, they are both tips put on the receipt. Rome is a big city, that's wy for the colloseum and the roman forum you must use the public transport, but the hotel is close to the termini railway station, where you can find metro and bus stations. The hotel is close to the Trevi fountain and the spanish steps, also Piazza della Republica. A very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location is closed to Termini Sta”
Reviews.Author: Beaniee
Reviews.Content: It was walking distance to Termini station (10 mins). Since I bought the travel day pass, I took bus to the hotel (one stop from Termini). It would be better to ask people where the hotel located because the hotel was on the third floor of a building. No big sign of the hotel. Castelfidardo shared the same building with hotel Lazzari. We booked for Castelfidardo but we stayed in hotel Lazzari (5th floor). As the lift was old type, we climbed from first floor to third floor because the last user didnt close the door. Breakfast was not good. One guest was only entitle for one bread/croissont and one drink at nearby cafe by presenting the breakfast voucher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: missperry100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very basic and the pictures are accurate - if you're after luxery this is not the place BUT the staff were great, very friendly and helpful, excellent customer service. We went in winter and it was cold - they turn the heating on at 7.30pm as standard but if you ask them they'll switch it on straight away. Great location and the restaurant just up the road was fabulous too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Castelfidarfdo in June 2006 - very easy to find, only a few minutes walk from Roma Termini, and the area is good, with some nice sidewalk restaurants very close-by. The owners were very quick to answer emails before we arrived, and were friendly when we got there. Different story a few days after we left and discovered we left a couple of items of clothing in the wardrobe - no reply to our email, but that's travel, I guess! Overall, I think that this was good value, a very cool lift to the 3rd/4th/5th floor, and good clean rooms. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Screamfeeder
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend trip to Rome. Stayed 2 nights at the Castelfidardo Hotel. The rooms are OK, but the bathrooms are very small. They said the breakfast was included in the rate but it`s not served at the hotel. You´ll receive a ticket to have a coffee and a single croissant in the bars nearby. The location is very good. Just a 10 minute walk from the Termini Station. In my opinion it`s a bit expensive, around 80 Euro for a double room.

Reviews.Title: “noisy but reasonnable price”
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill
Reviews.Content: During our honeymoon we stayed five nights in the Hotel Castelfidardo. It is very good located, Piazza della Repubblica is in walking distance and around the hotel are some nice restaurants. The room was very small but ok for the price. The main problem was that it was very loud, not because of traffic but because other guests closed the doors very noisily.

HotelInfo.Name: Brando & Gio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Castelfidardo 31, 00185 Rome, Italy (Formerly Hotel Castelfidardo)
